title: R. Nicholas Burns - Wikipedia
snippet: Robert Nicholas Burns (born January 28, 1956) is an American diplomat and international relations scholar. He served as the United States ambassador to China from 2022 to 2025. He is now Roy and Barbara Goodman Family Professor of the Practice of Diplomacy and International Relations at Harvard ...

title: Former U.S. Ambassador to China To Return to Kennedy School Professorship | News | The Harvard Crimson
snippet: Former U.S. Ambassador to China R. Nicholas Burns will return to the Harvard Kennedy School as a professor this April, joining the Fairbank Center for Chinese Studies, the University announced earlier this week.

title: Longtime Harvard Kennedy School faculty member Nicholas Burns to return to HKS after serving as U.S. envoy to China | Harvard Kennedy School
snippet: — Nicholas Burns, who until recently served as the United States ambassador to the People’s Republic of China, will rejoin the Harvard Kennedy School faculty in April, Dean Jeremy M. Weinstein announced today.
